eslint.experimental.useFlatConfig.description: Enables support of experimental Flat Config (aka eslint.config.js, supported by ESLint version 8.21 or later).

eslint.enable.description: Controls whether eslint is enabled or not.

eslint.quiet.description: Turns on quiet mode, which ignores warnings.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path starts with this directory.

changeProcessCWD.description: Whether the process's cwd should be changed as well.

directory.description: The working directory to use if a file's path starts with this directory.

!cwd.description: Set to true if ESLint shouldn't change the working directory.
Set to true if ESLint shouldn't change the working directory.

pattern.description: A glob pattern to match a working directory.

eslint.workingDirectories.markdownDescription: Specifies how the working directories ESLint is using are computed. ESLint resolves configuration files (e.g. `eslintrc`, `.eslintignore`) relative to a working directory so it is important to configure this correctly.

eslint.ignoreUntitled.description: If true, untitled files won't be validated by ESLint.

eslint.debug.markdownDescription: Enables ESLint debug mode (same as `--debug` on the command line)

eslint.timeBudget.onFixes.markdownDescription: The time budget in milliseconds to spend on computing fixes before showing a warning or error.

error.markdownDescription: The time budget in milliseconds to spend on computing fixes before showing an error.

warn.markdownDescription: The time budget in milliseconds to spend on computing fixes before showing a warning.

eslint.useESLintClass.description: Since version 7 ESLint offers a new API call ESLint. Use it even if the old CLIEngine is available. From version 8 on forward on ESLint class is available.

eslint.codeActionsOnSave.rules.markdownDescription: The rules that should be executed when computing the code actions on save or formatting a file. Defaults to the rules configured via the ESLint configuration

eslint.provideLintTask.deprecationMessage: This option is deprecated. Use eslint.lintTask.enable instead.
eslint.provideLintTask.description: Controls whether a task for linting the whole workspace will be available.

eslint.probe.description: An array of language ids for which the extension should probe if support is installed.

eslint.codeActionsOnSave.mode.markdownDescription: Specifies the code action mode. Possible values are 'all' and 'problems'.
enumDescriptions: Fixes all possible problems in the file. This option might take some time.
Fixes only reported problems that have non-overlapping textual edits. This option runs a lot faster.

eslint.notebooks.rules.customizations.description: A special rules customization section for text cells in notebook documents.

eslint.migration.2_x.description: Whether ESlint should migrate auto fix on save settings.

eslint.packageManager.deprecationMessage: The setting is deprecated. The Package Manager is automatically detected now.
eslint.packageManager.description: The package manager you use to install node modules.

eslint.options.markdownDescription: The eslint options object to provide args normally passed to eslint when executed from a command line (see https://eslint.org/docs/developer-guide/nodejs-api#eslint-class).

eslint.rules.customizations.description: Override the severity of one or more rules reported by this extension, regardless of the project's ESLint config. Use globs to apply default severities for multiple rules.

eslint.run.description: Run the linter on save (onSave) or on type (onType)

eslint.timeBudget.onValidation.markdownDescription: The time budget in milliseconds to spend on validation before showing a warning or error.

error.markdownDescription: The time budget in milliseconds to spend on validation before showing an error.

warn.markdownDescription: The time budget in milliseconds to spend on validation before showing a warning.

eslint.autoFixOnSave.deprecationMessage: The setting is deprecated. Use editor.codeActionsOnSave instead with a source.fixAll.eslint member.
eslint.autoFixOnSave.description: Turns auto fix on save on or off.

eslint.runtime.markdownDescription: The location of the node binary to run ESLint under.

eslint.lintTask.enable.description: Controls whether a task for linting the whole workspace will be available.

eslint.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VSCode and the eslint linter service.

eslint.problems.shortenToSingleLine.description: Shortens the text spans of underlined problems to their first related line.

eslint.lintTask.options.markdownDescription: Command line options applied when running the task for linting the whole workspace (see https://eslint.org/docs/user-guide/command-line-interface).

eslint.nodePath.markdownDescription: A path added to `NODE_PATH` when resolving the eslint module.

eslint.onIgnoredFiles.description: Whether ESLint should issue a warning on ignored files.

anyOf.deprecationMessage: Auto Fix is enabled by default. Use the single string form.

autoFix.description: Whether auto fixes are provided for the language.

language.description: The language id to be validated by ESLint.

eslint.validate.description: An array of language ids which should be validated by ESLint. If not installed ESLint will show an error.

eslint.execArgv.markdownDescription: Additional exec argv argument passed to the runtime. This can for example be used to control the maximum heap space using --max_old_space_size

eslint.codeAction.disableRuleComment.markdownDescription: Show disable lint rule in the quick fix menu.

commentStyle.definition: The comment style to use when disabling a rule on a specific line.

location.description: Configure the disable rule code action to insert the comment on the same line or a new line.

eslint.nodeEnv.markdownDescription: The value of `NODE_ENV` to use when running eslint tasks.

eslint.codeAction.showDocumentation.markdownDescription: Show open lint rule documentation web page in the quick fix menu.
